intro: Diplospora abnormis, commonly known as the abnormal diplospora, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a complex arrangement of bracts and inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctively pinnate structure, and its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically interesting but poorly studied species.
